p: The most common gross and histologic lesions observed in California in chickens infected with H6N2 in 2000â€“2002, were fibrinous yolk peritonitis, salpingitis, oophoritis and nephritis. Oedema of the mesentery of the oviduct and pale, swollen kidneys were also observed. Mortality in infected flocks ranged from 0.25% to 3%, and egg production dropped 7% to 40%.
